intro: Curtia quadrifolia, commonly known as the four-leafed curtia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which often have four lobes, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Curtia quadrifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
